War in Ukraine: The daily lives of Kherson residents who live underground, threatened by Russian drones
subhead: Photographer Virginie Nguyen Hoang captured for Le Monde the daily lives of Kherson residents who live under the constant threat of a 'human safari' − a manhunt carried out by Russian drones. With no way to leave the city, they survive in makeshift underground shelters.

title: Powerful earthquake in the Philippines kills over two dozen and injures nearly 150 as search efforts continue
subhead: The Cebu provincial government has put out a call on its official Facebook page for medical volunteers to assist in the aftermath of the 6.9-magnitude quake. The rescue effort proceeded all night, even as the Philippine Institute of Volcanology and Seismology said the region was being rocked by 379 aftershocks.

subhead: The far-right party doubled its number of local councilors in Duisburg and Hagen in mid-September.

Svalbard, the fastest-warming place on Earth
subhead: 'Our planet at +1.5°C' (1/6). The Norwegian archipelago has warmed by 4°C over the past 30 years. Landslides and thawing permafrost threaten the population, whose way of life is highly greenhouse gas-intensive.

title: How can Europe withstand pressure from Russia and the US? Two experts debate
subhead: Tensions with Russia to the East and the United States to the West are testing Europe's model. Sylvain Kahn and Guillaume Lagane examine this shifting landscape and the possible responses.

title: The day Sarkozy learned he was going to prison
subhead: Nicolas Sarkozy will become the first former president of the French Republic to sleep behind bars after being convicted of criminal conspiracy, in the case of alleged Libyan financing of his 2007 presidential campaign.
